isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Engine Systems - Diamond Logic® Engine Brake - Operation of Diamond Logic® Engine Brake in Braking Mode

svcproc.title: Operation of Diamond Logic® Engine Brake in Braking Mode

figure.caption: Brake shut-off valve and brake actuator- ON

calloutgroup.callout1: High-pressure oil flow to brake oil gallery

svcproc.para: The ECM monitors the following criteria to make sure certain conditions are met.

item.para: Operator input switches (On/Off) (power selection - Low, Med, High)

svcproc.para: If On is selected, and the preceding criteria is met, the engine brake will activate.

When the engine brake is activated, the ECM provides the power to activate the brake shut-off valve to allow oil from the injector oil gallery to flow to the brake oil gallery. High oil pressure activates the brake actuator pistons to open the exhaust valves.
During an ABS event, the engine brake is deactivated. The engine brake is activated once the ABS event is over.

figure.caption: Brake pressure relief valve in high-pressure oil rail

svcproc.para: The ECM removes the power source from the brake shut-off valve to deactivate the engine brake. Residual brake gallery pressure initially bleeds from the actuator bore. When brake gallery pressure bleeds down to 6895 kPa (1000 psi), the brake pressure relief valve opens, and oil drains back to sump.
